result.execSummary:
The defendant Edward A Holley Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Huber privileges under Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats. to apply for work.

miscConds.notes: *  Pay costs, surcharges, assessments, supervision, and DNA fees out of bail on deposit, if any, with the balance due prior to the end of the probationary period. Failure to pay shall result in a Civil Judgment with tax intercept.
*  Maintain full time / part time employment and or schooling.
*  No new law violations reaching the level of a probable cause finding.

*  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
*  AODA assessment with follow up care and treatment.
*  Random urine screens with no positive results.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Edward A Holley Jr

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Request to Issue Civil Judgment for Court Ordered Obligations received and forwarded to Ali. os

Signed and filed: Order for Cancellation of Huber/Work Release/Electronic Surveillance Privileges. Copies conveyed to the defendant (at HOC), Elizabeth Rowe (corrections lieutenant), DA's office, and defense counsel.

Huber/Work Release Modification Request
.
Request for Huber / Work Release Modification received from HOC and filed this date.  This case is assigned and forwarded to Judge Hanrahan Br 4 for review. os

Statements made as to Sentencing by both counsel and Defendant.

Defendant sentenced to serve  90 DAYS in the House of Correction with credit for 0 days time served.  Huber privileges under Sec.303.08 Wis. Stats. to apply for work.  

Court IMPOSED AND STAYED the sentence and placed Defendant on Probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 12 Months with the following conditions as to probation:
*  No new law violations reaching the level of a probable cause finding.
*  Cooperate with the agent.
*  Pay costs, surcharges, assessments, supervision, and DNA fees out of bail on deposit, if any, with the balance due prior to the end of the probationary period. Failure to pay shall result in a Civil Judgment with tax intercept.
*  Maintain full time / part time employment and or schooling.
*  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
*  AODA assessment with follow up care and treatment.
*  Random urine screens with no positive results.

Received and filed with court:
*  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief Form

Defendant Edward A Holley in court with attorney Kelsey E Mader.  Margaret Anne Kunisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Defendant waived rights and pled GUILTY.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the Defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.  Parties are prepared to proceed with Sentencing.

Defendant Edward A Holley in court with attorney Kelsey Estelle Mader.  Margaret Anne Kunisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Court is in trial, case heard off the record. Defense counsel requests case be set for pojected guilty plea.  Neither party requests to address the court on the record. Signed, Filed & Distributed, Agreed Upon Request for A New Court Date form.  Case adjourned to Branch 45.  Plea hearing scheduled for February 22, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Edward A Holley in court with attorney Kelsey Estelle Mader.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Counsel recently retained. Defense requests a status conference date. Court orders case adjourned to Branch 45.  Status conference scheduled for January 6, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Edward A Holley in court PRO SE.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Defendant requests more time to hire counsel. Court grants LAST adjournment. Case adjourned to branch 45 for Status of Counsel.  Status conference scheduled for November 25, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Edward A Holley in court. Morgan Wilz, student intern, under the supervision of Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant needs more time to retain counsel. Case adjourned to Branch 23.  Status conference scheduled for October 26, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant; Original in file. ($200.00 signature bond) gj

Defendant Edward A Holley in court.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Statements by defendant that he thought today was 7-16-2015.  Court orders bench warrant cancelled.  
Defendant needs additional time to obtain counsel. Court orders case adjourned for status of counsel.  Parties are notified that effective August 3, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Lindsey Grady, Branch 23 in Courthouse room 515.  Status conference scheduled for August 25, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 200.00.

Defendant Edward A Holley not in court.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case scheduled for pretrial conference.  The defendant having failed to appear, the court ordered a bench warrant to issue, any bond forfeited and Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification by the Clerk of Circuit Court.

Defendant Edward A Holley in court.  James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 45. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel.   Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 45.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 7/1/15 @ 1:30pm
